meanings.definition: To cause someone to become mentally impaired or disoriented.
meanings.sent1: The confusing maze was dementing the poor mouse.
meanings.sent2: The loud noises were dementing the old man with dementia.
meanings.sent3: The tricky riddle was dementing the clever fox.
meanings.sent4: The fog demented the landscape, hiding everything from view.
meanings.sent5: The hypnotic dance of the flames was dementing to watch.

meanings.definition: Characterized by mental impairment or disorientation.
meanings.sent1: The dementing fog made it hard to see the path ahead.
meanings.sent2: The dementing effects of the illness left her confused and forgetful.
meanings.sent3: The dementing mirror made everyone look funny at the carnival.
meanings.sent4: The dementing whispers in the haunted house sent shivers down their spines.
meanings.sent5: The dementing dream left her feeling lost and unsure of reality.
